SEARCH
Package aas_core.aas3_0.types.model

Interface IReference

All Superinterfaces:
IClass
All Known Implementing Classes:
EnhancedReference, Reference
public interface IReference extends IClass
Reference to either a model element of the same or another AAS or to an external entity.

A reference is an ordered list of keys.

A model reference is an ordered list of keys, each key referencing an element. The complete list of keys may for example be concatenated to a path that then gives unique access to an element.

An external reference is a reference to an external entity.

Constraints:

  • Constraint AASd-121: For Reference's the value of Key.getType() of the first key of " getKeys() shall be one of Constants.globallyIdentifiables.
  • Constraint AASd-122: For external references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.EXTERNAL_REFERENCE, the value of Key.getType() of the first key of getKeys() shall be one of Constants.genericGloballyIdentifiables.
  • Constraint AASd-123: For model references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.MODEL_REFERENCE, the value of Key.getType() of the first key of getKeys() shall be one of Constants.aasIdentifiables.
  • Constraint AASd-124: For external references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.EXTERNAL_REFERENCE, the last key of getKeys() shall be either one of Constants.genericGloballyIdentifiables or one of Constants.genericFragmentKeys.
  • Constraint AASd-125: For model references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.MODEL_REFERENCE, with more than one key in getKeys() the value of Key.getType() of each of the keys following the first key of getKeys() shall be one of Constants.fragmentKeys.

    Constraint AASd-125 ensures that the shortest path is used.

  • Constraint AASd-126: For model references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.MODEL_REFERENCE, with more than one key in getKeys() the value of Key.getType() of the last key in the reference key chain may be one of Constants.genericFragmentKeys or no key at all shall have a value out of Constants.genericFragmentKeys.
  • Constraint AASd-127: For model references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.MODEL_REFERENCE, with more than one key in getKeys() a key with Key.getType() KeyTypes.FRAGMENT_REFERENCE shall be preceded by a key with Key.getType() KeyTypes.FILE or KeyTypes.BLOB. All other AAS fragments, i.e. Key.getType() values out of Constants.aasSubmodelElementsAsKeys, do not support fragments.

    Which kind of fragments are supported depends on the content type and the specification of allowed fragment identifiers for the corresponding resource being referenced via the reference.

  • Constraint AASd-128: For model references, i.e. Reference's with getType() = ReferenceTypes.MODEL_REFERENCE, the Key.getValue() of a Key preceded by a Key with Key.getType() = KeyTypes.SUBMODEL_ELEMENT_LIST is an integer number denoting the position in the array of the submodel element list.

    • getReferredSemanticId

      Optional<IReference> getReferredSemanticId()
      IHasSemantics.getSemanticId() of the referenced model element (getType() = ReferenceTypes.MODEL_REFERENCE).

      For external references there typically is no semantic ID.

      It is recommended to use a external reference.
